content: Stocks Investments Annual General Meetings (AGM) Asked by Guo Hao TeoAsked on 10 Apr 2019How much shares do you need to own before you are entitled to attend AGM?I’m interested in a stock and would wish to get more information. But the stock I’m interested in is really expensive, eg DBS. How much should I buy in order to get access to that information?2 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Kenichi Xi, nᴉʍ oʇ dǝnᴉʇsǝd 不能说的秘密 at Tag Team with Gabriel ThamLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 10 Apr 2019Just to add.one lot is 100 shares (unit) in sg exch.so minimim one lot will do.hope my replies help.0 comments1

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 10 Apr 2019Hey there! You actually only need to own at least 1 share to be able to attend the AGM. And note that this share has to be held by you in your CDP (central depositary)However, take note that if you are using a custodian account, you are unable to attend as legally you do not directly own the shares.You can find out more here: https://blog.seedly.sg/cdp-vs-custodian-account/0 comments0
